Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) seem to be a promising technology for the energy generation of tomorrow.
Titulo: Experimental evaluation of the operating temperature impact on solid oxide anode-supported fuel cells

Sentencas: Such devices are very complex and performances are strictly dependent on the understanding of basic concepts and development of new materials.
Titulo: Experimental evaluation of the operating temperature impact on solid oxide anode-supported fuel cells

Sentencas: The actual demonstrated target of SOFCs is around 1 W/cm(2) of power density at the operating temperature of 750 degrees C and practical fuel utilization (>50%); the goal for the next years is to reach 2 W/cm(2) at 650 degrees C of power density.
Titulo: Experimental evaluation of the operating temperature impact on solid oxide anode-supported fuel cells

Sentencas: The achievement of this goal depends mainly on the investigation of high-performance materials and on the developing of diagnostic and analytical techniques to deeply understand the cells' behaviour; moreover, the improvement of performance is strictly related to the manufacturing processes.
Titulo: Experimental evaluation of the operating temperature impact on solid oxide anode-supported fuel cells

Sentencas: In this paper is shown a study dealing with a comparison of two planar anode-supported SOFCs differing for cathode materials.
Titulo: Experimental evaluation of the operating temperature impact on solid oxide anode-supported fuel cells

Sentencas: in fact it is known that cathode overvoltage is a limiting factor for such cells' design.
Titulo: Experimental evaluation of the operating temperature impact on solid oxide anode-supported fuel cells

Sentencas: Tests were performed on SOFCs of anode-supported design at L.A.Q. IN.TE.S.E.
Titulo: Experimental evaluation of the operating temperature impact on solid oxide anode-supported fuel cells

Sentencas: In the paper, results are presented concerning the characterization of planar circular-shaped cells from InDEC (R) with lanthanum strontium manganite (LSM) and lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite oxide (LSCF) cathodes.
Titulo: Experimental evaluation of the operating temperature impact on solid oxide anode-supported fuel cells

Sentencas: It is shown that cell performance can be increased via material selection; in fact, the power density of around 0.8 W/cm(2) is reached at 850 degrees C for the cell with LSM cathode and at 750 degrees C for the cell with LSCF cathode.
Titulo: Experimental evaluation of the operating temperature impact on solid oxide anode-supported fuel cells
